title: Teen arrested after deadly shooting
content:

Altoona, Blair County, Pa.
A shooting in the early morning hours in Altoona leaves one man dead.
Michael Corle,19, is accused of shooting his friend in the head around 4 a.m. Thursday.
The incident happened in the 1600 block of Second Avenue, a couple blocks south of the Altoona Area High School.
When police arrived on scene, they found a 19 year old man dead in his home.
Corle was found in his mother's home along 5th Avenue three hours later, around 7 o'clock.
He was taken into custody. Police say he then them on the search for the revolver he used and buried.
The gun was found near Logan Elementary school. Investigators say they had to use a metal detector to find the weapon.
Lt. Jeff Pratt of the Altoona Police Department spoke to WTAJ about the shooting, "Not only do firearms mix with drugs of any kind, they don't mix with alcohol. Unfortunately I think there was a lethal mix of drug use, gun play and carelessness resulting in the death of a young person."
Corle will be charged with felony offenses, but Pratt says this is largely a case of negligence.
